intro: Oligochaetochilus trypherus, commonly known as the slender hair-moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, elongated stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, hairy structures. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, including capsules, are borne on short, upright stalks. Oligochaetochilus trypherus plays a vital role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its ecosystem.
